nombre: Environment to support learning of data structures in Python
descripcion: This document presents the design process, development, and results of creating a Python application that allows students to obtain feedback on data structures they have created. This application is built to serve as a support for learning the subject mentioned above, since in most cases a high level of difficulty is perceived due to the abstraction of the subject. As a result, the application is successfully built, which supports data structures such as linked lists, ordered binary trees, and graphs. In addition, a series of probable error cases are taken into account, for which management and information is provided to allow the student to correct their implementation.

nombre: System for the Automation of Inspection Tasks of Physical Structures Using a Drone
descripcion: This work presents the design and implementation of a system to automate the task of inspecting a physical structure, bounded by a simple geometric envelope, using a drone. In particular, the DJI Mavic Pro drone was used, but the system is designed to work with any DJI brand drone. For this system, the user can choose from one of three simple geometric envelope models provided (plane, box, and cylinder) to represent the structure to be inspected. The system then plans the drone's flight path in order to ensure that the entire envelope model is covered in the inspection, and then the drone executes the flight autonomously. The system consists of two main software components: a ROS robotics application used for drone control and an Android application to enable communication with the drone using DJI Mobile SDK V4. The system was tested with the Gazebo simulator and the DJI Assistant 2 simulator to ensure its correct operation. Finally, it was tested in an experimental (real) scenario to inspect the front of a building, obtaining satisfactory results.

nombre: Defender of culture
descripcion: Defender of Culture is an educational game with entertaining gameplay that seeks to teach and test the player's general culture knowledge, through the fight against art thieves and the protection of valuable works of art in museums around the world.

nombre: Human development for the brave: virtual reality application to support the generation of empathy
descripcion: The project aims to support the generation of empathy that can be created through 360 virtual reality videos. To this end, a virtual reality application was developed in which 360 videos can be played. Using this application, functionalities with the potential to contribute to the generation of empathy were explored. These were validated in experiments with users to optimize them and find new opportunities for improvement. At the end of the project, it was determined that Bullet comments are a participation mechanism that supports the generation of empathy. It is hoped that this project will serve as motivation for future research that explores the potential of virtual reality as a tool to support the generation of empathy.

nombre: Design of a route planning and tracking system in an indoor scenario with a mobile robot
descripcion: This project consists of the design, integration, design of experiments and characterization of a solution for a system that can be used as a guide for visitors within the Mario Laserna Building of the Universidad de los Andes. Therefore, it is important to consider the situation in which a visitor who arrives at the Mario Laserna Building intends to go to a particular point, such as: the library, an office, a laboratory or a classroom, among others. Therefore, there must be an interaction with the guide robot to indicate what its point of interest is. Therefore, the robot, upon receiving this point, carries out the planning of a route between the point where this first approach occurs and the destination point. In this case, the challenge is addressed from the integration of different mobile robot platforms to create an appropriate solution...

nombre: Path planning and following through genetic algorithms for solving Multi-Travel Salesman Problem in Dynamic Scenarios
descripcion: This paper presents an implementation of a technique to solve the problem of Multi-Travel Salesman Problem (MTSP) applied on mobile robots in dynamic scenarios. Because MTSP is a NP-Complete problem, we use genetic algorithms in order to resolve it efficiently. Once we got a theoretical solution for MTSP, we required to apply this on simulated and experimental scenarios. That is why we implement path planning algorithms to generate the path for each of the robots. Finally, we implement evasion algorithms for manage dynamic scenarios. With those main challenges clear, we test these implementations on simulation and laboratory in order to measure the quality indicators of the proposed solution.

nombre: Definition of an architecture for the creation of web applications integrating lego EV3 robots
descripcion: This project consists of defining a base architecture for the creation of Web applications for the management, control or programming of Lego Mindstorms EV3 robots. Currently, there are very few projects that work with Lego Mindstorms EV3 robots, especially in the Web field, so a Web architecture is proposed which will serve as a base and guide for future projects. Therefore, technologies that satisfy the proposed architecture are investigated and integrated. As part of the architecture, a robot is built using a Lego Mindstorms EV3 Kit for the execution of commands sent from the Web client. The basic functionality of the robot is implemented using the LeJOS API. There is an intermediate component that is responsible for receiving requests from the Web client and sending them to the robot to be executed. Finally, a demo application based on the proposed architecture is implemented that allows connection tests, execution of basic and complex commands.

nombre: Tadava : visual analytics architecture for large table-based datasets
descripcion: Visual Analytics provide the user with tools to process data in a very intuitive way. One of the challenges Visual Analytics faces nowadays is the need to represent big amounts of information in a way that the user can explore. This large amount of data can not be managed by conventional machines and must be partitioned or underrepresented. Usually, visual analytics applications or widgets work with one single machine due to the requirements of low latency and quick interactions. This article presents Tadava, a visual analytics architecture based on representative sampling for large table-based datasets. Datasets samples are generated using systematics sampling and random sampling in order to obtain a collection of data from the original dataset. Experiments are made to determine the best sampling method to be used in datasets of different sizes, varying the step expected between samples. Tadava is built as a backend architecture for Navio, an interactive visualization widget for summarizing, exploring and navigating large datasets, and provides the widget with the capacity to manage table-based datasets between 400MB and 4GB.

nombre: Visualizing Taxonomic Reports from Biological Sequence Alignments
descripcion: Biological sequence comparison is a crucial step towards the process of identifying and cataloging new sequences. To achieve this, computational biologists must compare a new sequence to the permanently-growing biological databases. This comparison produces a myriad of results, from where extracting useful information is highly cost-intensive given the lack of tools providing an overview of the results. Moreover, itis possible to mistakenlycatalognewsequencesduetopoorcomparison analysis. This project is the outcome of a close collaboration with domain experts and a thorough study of the state of the art. As a result, six analysis tasks commonly performed by bioinformaticians were identified. Each task consists either in summarizing (for single sequence results) or comparing (for multiple sequence results): regionsofinterest(AT1), taxonomic reports(AT2),and sequences descriptions (AT3).

nombre: Exploring treemaps for summarizing and navigating image galleries
descripcion: Treemaps are a two-dimensional representation of complex traditional tree structures, which show the leaf nodes as rectangular blocks with a size associated to the nodes data, so the numeric value of the data will determinate the size of the block [7]. Since its creation by Ben Shneiderman in 1991, the representation of image collections have followed this alternative in the recent years. It has shown how treemaps are effective in the task of provide to the user a quick overview which show the relevance of their images.

nombre: CAAVAT: Computer Assisted Analysis of Visceral Adipose Tissue on CT Images
descripcion: CAAVAT is a fast and reliable tool suitable to be used in clinical practice for CT VAT quantification in the diagnostic of the metabolic syndrome. BACKGROUND Individuals with high accumulation of visceral adipose tissue (VAT) are characterized by a set of alterations known as metabolic syndrome with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes, dyslipidemia, and coronary heart disease.

nombre: Astronomical image processing from large all-sky photometric surveys for the detection and measurement of type Ia supernovae
descripcion: The detection of transient objects has become an important research topic in astronomy today. To detect, report and study such phenomena, different approaches have been proposed, among them, the use of image processing pipelines. Using the LSST Science Pipelines Stack (or Stack), a framework created by the LSST data team, we developed additions to one of such pipelines in charge of detecting type IA supernovae in CFHT telescope images. We managed to run a complete pipeline, with reduced processing times, achieving a reduction of up to 80% of the number of doubtful detections, reporting 95% candidate light curves and preserving up to 85% of the high-signal Ia supernovae present.

nombre: 3RCity
descripcion: The project consists in the development of a serious videogame, using the SCRUM methodology. The game teaches the player how recycling is happening in a city.

nombre: Adaptic: A Shape Changing Prop with Haptic Retargeting
descripcion: Adaptic, a novel ”hybrid” active/passive haptic device that can change shape to act as a proxy for a range of virtual objects in VR. We use Adaptic with haptic retargeting to redirect the user’s hand to provide haptic feedback for several virtual objects in arm’s reach using only a single prop. To evaluate the effectiveness of Adaptic with haptic retargeting, we conducted a within-subjects experiment employing a docking task to compare Adaptic to non-matching proxy objects (i.e., Styrofoam balls) and matching shape props. In our study, Adaptic sat on a desk in front of the user and changed shapes between grasps, to provide matching tactile feedback for various virtual objects placed in different virtual locations. Results indicate that the illusion was convincing: users felt they were manipulating several virtual objects in different virtual locations with a single Adaptic device. Docking performance (completion time and accuracy) with Adaptic was comparable to props without haptic retargeting.

nombre: Balance Universal
descripcion: The life of a college student is full of challenges, effort and achievements through this period of their life in which they are searching, studying and preparing for their work life. However, this also comes with high levels of stress, unbalance and unhealthy habits that can have negative effects on the mental health of students in the medium term. Through the development of a serious game in which the engineering process and agile methodologies of development were used, we try to make players experiment and be more conscious of this conundrum that many students go through. This conundrum is not talked about enough outside of the academic field of psychology. This video game was developed and published until reaching a beta version looking for feedback and validation from users inside the age range of the average college student.

nombre: Boom Away
descripcion: The project began by exploring experimental mechanics relating to the use of explosives as a means of movement in a 2D environment in order to complete levels designed around this characteristic. Nonetheless, throughout the semester we, apart from achieving just that, made the game into a fully fledged out experience. We used principles learned during our years in this major to implement a robust architecture following the S.O.L.I.D. principles in order to make a fully scalable and perfectly usable application. Furthermore, we collected analytics about the way players interacted with our game; we took this data and transformed it into information and later into knowledge so we could understand the problems our players were facing during their playtime. Finally, we used this knowledge to iterate over our design and implementation and make an even better experience.

nombre: Corruptio
descripcion: One of the most prominent problems in Colombia and Latin America is corruption. For this reason, Corruptio was created as a way to raise awareness and encourage young people to have a greater role in politics, by developing an interactive video game. This video game puts the player in the role of the mayor of a city, where he must perform tasks such as managing the city's budget and making decisions about specific events, all while maintaining a positive popularity score to avoid being removed from office. During the development time, an MVP (Minimum Viable Product) was developed and published online with the objective of obtaining feedback from players in order to launch a second MVP, which takes into account all the feedback obtained in the testing stage.

nombre: Domicilio Survivor
descripcion: Reckless driving, especially of motorcyclists, is one of the most relevant causes of death on Colombian streets and therefore represents one of the most daily occurring problems. However, it is given very little importance by the population, since it has become a habit for drivers to think that traffic regulations are a suggestion rather than an obligation, especially in small towns where motorcycles abound. For this reason, the objective of this project is to make drivers aware of the risks involved in not following the traffic norms. To this end, they are shown a familiar context in which the possible consequences of reckless driving can be represented.

nombre: Training in seismic safety practices using virtual reality
descripcion: The project seeks to support the learning of prevention measures and safety protocols that must be applied to be better protected and prepared for an earthquake. This through the development of an immersive video game in virtual reality that improves the retention of knowledge.

nombre: Total immersion: creating the Digital Twin of the Colivri Laboratory at the University of Los Andes
descripcion: This project develops an advanced Digital Twin for the Colivri laboratory at the University of Los Andes, using Unity to model a three-dimensional environment deployed in desktop, virtual reality, augmented reality, and mixed reality applications. Functionality is ensured on cutting-edge devices such as Meta Quest 2, Meta Quest Pro, multiscreen equipment, HTC VIVE Pro, and Microsoft HoloLens 2, with an emphasis on essential features such as graphic adaptability and real-time monitoring of remote computer system performance. A central server promotes efficient communication via HTTP, while image analysis integration facilitates interaction with physical object movements. This academic effort highlights the use of agile methodologies and tools such as Jira and Git, emphasizing the strengthening of collaborative skills among students in Systems and Computer Engineering.
lugarpublicacion: Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá, Colombia

nombre: VR Salsa: learn to dance in virtual reality
descripcion: VR Salsa was the development of a VR environment to teach people how to dance salsa. The goal was to design a tool that provided a safe space to learn for people who do not feel comfortable dancing, so they could learn at their own phase. The system was tested with users to determine the effectiveness and qualities, the results were registered.

nombre: Model for micro-simulation of vehicular and pedestrian traffic using CUDA
descripcion: The platform uses micro-simulation algorithms and has a discrete space representation, so a grid of cells is used; each cell contains information about the discrete space it represents, and this information is saved in a texture image that is stored in the GPU memory. The document begins with a theoretical framework that shows different driving simulators, which are compared to each other to determine which one meets the greatest number of necessary characteristics. Later, the context of the environment to be simulated is explained and an introduction to CUDA is made, explaining how this architecture is going to be used in the simulator. Then, the format and origin of the geographic data of the environment to be simulated is explained and the way in which these data are extended to give rise to the use of local and global goals. Because the simulator executes each entity in parallel, the phases of the simulation step that avoid the appearance of inconsistencies in the simulator are explained. Later, a performance analysis is made, the limitations and future work are shown.

nombre: Perceived Space and Spatial Performance during Path-Integration Tasks in Consumer-Oriented Virtual Reality Environments
descripcion: Studies using virtual reality environments (VE) have shown that sub-jects can perform path integration tasks with acceptable performance.However, in these studies, subjects could walk naturally across largetracking areas, or researchers provided them with large-immersivedisplays. Unfortunately, these conﬁgurations are far from currentconsumer-oriented VEs (COVEs), and little is known about howtheir limitations inﬂuence this task. Using a triangle completionparadigm, we assessed the subjects’ spatial performance when devel-oping path integration tasks in two consumer-oriented displays (anHTC Vive and a GearVR) and two consumer-oriented interactiondevices (a Virtuix Omni Treadmill and a Touchpad Control). Ourresults show that when locomotion is available (treadmill condition),there exist signiﬁcant effects regarding the display and the path. Incontrast, when locomotion is mediated no effect was found. Somefuture research directions are therefore proposed.

nombre: Raising awareness in the land reparation process
descripcion: The project aims to raise knowledge of the stages that are carried out during a land repair process, as well as raise conscience and awareness about its difficulty. For this, a simulation video-game is proposed through the use of virtual reality.

nombre: Escape Room VR : a tool for diagnosis and treatment of ADD
descripcion: Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD) is characterized by the lack of a long attention span. Both its diagnosis and treatment can be improved or helped using technology. Since the number of people suffering from it has been increasing for years, this paper intends to create a new alternative to improve the treatment of this disorder using Virtual Reality as a tool to support mental health workers process to treat the disorder.

nombre: Shades of my Soul
descripcion: In the former document we talk about Shades of My Soul, a videogame in which the player is able to control two main characters at the same time, in order to take on challenges and problems found throughout the entire game. The project was born under the idea of creating new videogame mechanics and innovating through them throughout the development process. The whole development process took us from the conception of main game mechanics, coding, art, sounds and music. The development of the game was planned with the help of lean methodologies based on four main sprints that would tackle different problems in each one of them. Each sprint was composed of micro-sprints which were weekly meetings with our supervisor Pablo Figueroa. He helped us with feedback and improvements to be done throughout development.

nombre: Simulations for Autonomous Vehicles in CARLA environment from the extraction of patterns in video analysis of Bogotá
descripcion: This degree project consists of the design and implementation of a system for the generation of autonomous vehicle simulations from video analysis, in the open source software CARLA. Simulations are one of the most important and fundamental parts of automatic driving. However, the creation of realistic simulations, necessary for the proper testing of these vehicles, are often expensive and complex. For this reason, the project will make use of videos to automate the creation of simulations from patterns identified in the video analysis.

nombre: A perceptual calibration method to ameliorate the phenomenon of non-size-constancy in hetereogeneous VR displays
descripcion: The interception of the action-perception loop in virtual reality [VR] causes that understanding the effects of different display factors in spatial perception becomes a challenge. For example, studies have reported that there is not size-constancy, the perceived size of an object does not remain constant as its distance increases. This phenomenon is closely related to the reports of underestimation of distances in VR, which causes remain unclear. Despite the efforts improving the spatial cues regarding display technology and computer graphics, some interest has started to focus on the human side. In this study, we propose a perceptual calibration method which can ameliorate the effects of non-size-constancy in heterogeneous VR displays. The method was validated in a perceptual matching experiment comparing the performance between an HTC Vive HMD and a four-walls CAVE system. Results show that perceptual calibration based on interpupillary distance increments can solve partially the phenomenon of non-size-constancy in VR.

nombre: VR environment to prepare public presentations
descripcion: This project is part of the STAGE project previously developed by the University of Würzburg in Unreal Engine, which has as its main function supervised training for public speaking in university seminars. From this project, we want to create a new scenario to help people who want to prepare their presentations in an environment similar to that of a classroom, mainly so that they can be prepared for any type of reaction that the audience may have.

nombre: BIM-based mixed reality environments to improve AEC task performance
descripcion: The Building Information Modelling (BIM) currently contributes to deeply modify the Architecture, Construction and Engineering (AEC) industry by improving data management, task planning, and architecture design etc. Nevertheless, other technologies have also joined this revolution, with the aim of allowing experts to perform better their tasks with them than with only the BIM, particularly mixed reality (MR). However, MR applications can take very diverse forms, because of the multiple design choice possibilities: multiple data sources from the BIM (3D model, worksite monitoring, simulations.. .), multiple possibilities of visualisations in MR (visual effects, 4D.. .) and multiple MR interactions (move, write, say, grasp.. .). Behind MR application design choices, there is a task for which the application has been created. Yet, having BIM-based MR environments that really allow to respond to the original need and that improve task performance is a current difficulty. In this paper, we present our proposal of a methodology for going from BIM to BIM-based mixed reality environments. Our inputs are the AEC tasks which are likely to benefit from being performed in a mixed reality environment, their performance measures (efficiency and effectiveness), and BIM data. Our target is to provide BIM-based mixed reality environments that support specific AEC tasks, and to prove thanks to appropriate indicators that the task performance has improved in MR compared to traditional methods. Thus, we present here the results from our first case studies and their impact on the methodology evolution. Finally, our ongoing and future works are discussed in the last sections

nombre: Multimodal fracture reduction training simulator as a residency module
descripcion: The Halsted's Model for the skills learning on the orthopedical surgical room has showed some weaknesses fot the lower interaction which residents have on the surgical room. This is causing a higher learning curve for motor skills learning. The previous prototype of IMAGINE group deveolped for fractures reduction training was taken to extend it and offerr an integrable tool in the residencial formation for orthopedic surgeons. The result of this research process counts on a haptic and virtual-reality environment where distinct challenges can be propposed. For examples other fractures types including virtual elements which could increase the complexity (e. g. tissues to interact with). On the other hand the evaluation process was parametrized to allow define additional measures. A new measure was added about wrong boardings to neural and vascular tissues. Two fractures cases were added for the validation: middle third on the clavicule and distal radius.

nombre: SPLOR-T : an interactive urban spatiotemporal data exploration web approach
descripcion: The analysis of spatio-temporal urban data has evolved along the last 30 years. Data heterogeneity and segmented analysis is a frequent issue in this context. We present a new proposal to address these challenges by using the visual analytics approach in a web environment using the What-Where-When pyramidal paradigm to drive the analysis. Thanks to the flexibility of new web tools, we arrive to offer with S-PLOR-T a flexible and multi-screen web interface. Furthermore, we provide an architecture to allow to put coordinated visualizations, letting an analyst to have a clear notion of its data through interactions within the three main Wh* dimensions. With S-PLOR-T, the users will result in a customizable analysis in order to support the finding of new insights and support an effortless decision making with them. Additionally, our approach allows the user, not only to visual query any view, but to explore and to analyze multi-scale attributes within the space and the time. In this paper, we present a use case which was built and tested with domain experts in land use and mobility.

nombre: Proposal and visualization of an agent-based urban model
descripcion: It presents an urban segregation model based on three agents, namely, heads of household, investors and promoters. Through a simple visualization, the simulation results of the model can be accessed using a browser. The general purpose is to establish a relationship between the artificial intelligence tool, the economic simulation proposal and the manipulation of georeferenced data. To validate the model, the results were compared with previously proposed urban segregation models and the results were evaluated together with an expert in urban planning. In conclusion, a first version will be found, which, far from being able to be used in a decision support system, is useful because it allows to systematically see the behavior of the proposed agents under an urban and georeferenced context.

nombre: Wizard Chess
descripcion: Wizard Chess is a voice-controlled virtual reality chess game whose main objective is to encourage people who have had little contact with chess to play it in a more entertaining way. To do this, a cooperative multiplayer game was created in which the user can command the pieces by means of their voice in a setting with a magical atmosphere.

nombre: Passive Haptic Feedback for Control Elements in Virtual Reality
descripcion: We designed a controller-based hand input method that allows users to perceive haptic feedback with typical handheld controllers when interacting with virtual control elements while at the same time benefitting from precise controller-based tracking. We performed an experiment comparing our controller-based input method against native HMD hand tracking. Interestingly, hand tracking was robust and precise during interactions with most control elements in our experimental setup. A surprising outcome was that haptic feedback generally slowed down users during interaction, potentially due to a fear of hitting the physical surface during interaction.

nombre: OPVSim: Applying a Graph-Based Methodology for VR Training in Guided Learning of Emergency Procedures in a Ship's Engineering Room
descripcion: Virtual Reality (VR) can support effective and scalable training for procedures presented as step-by-step processes in machinery use, such as in an engineering room. Currently, many procedures are trained in closed experiences that do not allow for human errors or interaction with real subjects or machinery. Our goal is to address this gap by using VR training tools for guided procedural learning. To achieve this, we applied an existing methodology for designing such systems, called ProtoColVR, to develop a VR training simulation prototype for emergency procedures within an engineering room on a ship. The simulator, called OPVSim, employs end-to-end instruction, including a VR controls tutorial, step-by-step guided training based on graphs, offering different paths to the same goal, with feedback on correct and incorrect actions. We conducted a study with two groups of participants-cadets in training and experienced officers-to assess the effectiveness of the system developed using the described methodology. The study results reveal positive trends, including increased knowledge scores after using the simulator, and favorable outcomes for the prototype in terms of usability, presence, and workload. We discuss our findings, limitations, and the implications for designing VR training systems for guided procedural learning.
lugarpublicacion: Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá, Colombia

nombre: Training in the use of the engineering console for emergency procedures on a Colombian Navy OPV vessel using virtual reality
descripcion: The purpose of this project is to train the crew of the Colombian Navy's OPV ships in the use of the control panel of an engineering console. To do this, a full-scale model of the engineering console is calibrated with the virtual reality environment present in the Quest 2 and Quest Pro devices, using the Passthrough function that allows the real image captured by the viewer's cameras to be combined with the virtual world, thus achieving total synchronization between the console model and the virtual environment. Once this calibration has been carried out, hand recognition, known as Hand Tracking, is used to detect the user's interactions with any button or lever on the console and project the result of these interactions into the virtual environment, while the user experiences a pseudo-haptic sensation, as they will be interacting with the real buttons and levers on the model.
lugarpublicacion: Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá, Colombia

nombre: The Influence of Metaverse Environment Design on Learning Experiences in Virtual Reality Classes: A Comparative Study
descripcion: This study explores the potential of metaverse technologies for virtual education, comparing four platforms: Workrooms, Spatial, Mozilla Hubs, and Arthur. We evaluate factors like avatars, spatial arrangement, mobility, and functionalities' impact on concentration, usability, presence, and learning. While learning outcomes show no significant differences, substantial variations in the classroom experience emerge. Metaverses with limited movement and functionalities exhibit higher immersion, concentration, and presence. Moreover, avatars with enhanced facial expressiveness positively influence the overall learning experience.

nombre: The influence of metaverse environment design on the quality of experience in virtual reality classes: a comparative study
descripcion: We are interested in how metaverse technologies can provide an environment for future virtual education beyond traditional videoconferencing technologies. This study investigates learning and the quality of the classroom experience by conducting classes in four metaverse environments: Meta Horizon Workrooms, Spatial, Mozilla Hubs, and Arthur. Through the analysis of questionnaires, we assess the influence of factors such as avatars, spatial arrangement, mobility, and extra functionalities on concentration, usability, presence, and learning. While we did not observe significant differences in learning outcomes, our analysis reveals substantial variations in the quality of the classroom experience. Specifically, higher immersion, concentration, and presence levels were observed in metaverses with limited movement and functionalities. Also, our findings emphasize the positive impact of avatars with realistic facial expressions on enhancing the overall experience. Finally, we present lessons learned and offer recommendations for class configurations in the metaverse based on our questionnaire analysis.
lugarpublicacion: Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá, Colombia

nombre: ML340 Digital Twin Laboratory
descripcion: The ML340 communications and networks laboratory at Universidad de los Andes (Colombia) is a critical environment housing expensive and sensitive equipment, where ensuring optimal operating conditions is essential. In this project, an interactive digital twin of the ML340 laboratory was developed, integrating Internet of Things (IoT), Augmented Reality (AR), and web-based visualization technologies to improve real-time monitoring and control of space. Through a distributed IoT architecture, the laboratory was equipped with an array of sensors to measure environmental variables (temperature, humidity, CO₂ levels, noise), occupancy, energy consumption, and computing equipment usage. All captured data is transmitted to a central platform where it is stored and used to drive both a web dashboard and an immersive AR application. The web dashboard allows real-time monitoring of metrics and historical data analysis through interactive graphs, while the AR interface projects contextual information onto the laboratory’s physical environment. This solution enables informed decision-making based on instantly updated data, anticipating adverse conditions (for example, overheating or poor air quality) and facilitating predictive maintenance actions. As a result, the laboratory’s safety, energy efficiency, and comfort were improved, while simultaneously generating a permanent record of its state. The proposed digital twin demonstrates the value of integrating IoT, AR, and web systems for the intelligent management of academic spaces.
lugarpublicacion: Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá, Colombia
